profile.name: Khush Jain
profile.title: Cloud Engineering Leader
profile.summary: Seasoned Cloud Engineering Leader with 7+ years architecting and delivering cloud-native systems on AWS. Proven track record driving cost optimization, resilience improvements, and GenAI adoption at scale. Led cross-functional teams, shipped mission-critical platforms, and translated business goals into robust cloud solutions.

timeline.summary: Leading cloud delivery for a fintech lending platform. Managing a team of 4 engineers. Architected GenAI infrastructure, drove cost optimization, and improved system resilience.
Designed and implemented scalable AWS architectures. Led WAF/security hardening and S3 lifecycle automation initiatives. Reduced operational overhead and improved compliance posture.
Built and maintained cloud infrastructure for enterprise clients. Delivered infrastructure-as-code pipelines using Terraform and AWS CDK. Supported DevOps culture adoption across teams.

missions.title: Operation GenAI Portal
missions.challenge: Engineering teams spent weeks manually provisioning LLM environments and integrating AWS Bedrock services, creating a bottleneck that slowed AI experimentation and product delivery.
missions.solution: Designed and shipped a self-service LLM provisioning portal backed by AWS Bedrock. Automated environment setup with Terraform modules and built a unified API gateway for multi-model routing. Implemented cost guardrails and usage dashboards.

missions.title: Operation Fintech Command
missions.tagline: Cloud delivery leadership for lending platform
missions.challenge: The lending platform's cloud operations lacked engineering leadership. Delivery timelines were slipping, infrastructure debt was growing, and cross-team alignment was missing.
missions.solution: Stepped in as Cloud Engineering Lead managing 4 engineers. Established sprint cadences, introduced infrastructure review gates, and built a shared AWS architecture playbook. Reduced P1 incidents by introducing runbooks and on-call rotation.

missions.title: Operation Cost Siege
missions.challenge: Uncontrolled S3 storage costs were spiraling due to lack of data lifecycle governance. Terabytes of stale objects were accumulating across buckets with no automated cleanup.
missions.solution: Built an automated S3 lifecycle governance system using Lambda and CloudWatch Events. Created tiering policies (S3 → Glacier → deletion), tagging enforcement via AWS Config rules, and a monthly cost dashboard surfacing savings.

missions.title: Operation Iron Uptime
missions.challenge: The lending platform's disaster recovery was theoretical — RTO was 18 hours with untested playbooks. A real outage would cost hundreds of thousands in penalties and lost business.
missions.solution: Re-architected disaster recovery using multi-AZ RDS, cross-region S3 replication, and automated failover runbooks. Introduced chaos testing with AWS Fault Injection Simulator. Cut RTO from 18h to 6h and validated through quarterly DR drills.

missions.title: Operation Cyber Shield
missions.challenge: The platform faced DDoS and bot traffic with no WAF controls. Simultaneously, an ISO 27001 audit exposed 2+ PB of non-compliant data without proper retention policies or access controls.
missions.solution: Deployed AWS WAF on CloudFront with custom rule groups for bot mitigation and rate limiting. Led the data governance remediation — implemented S3 Object Lock, automated retention policies, and IAM least-privilege hardening. Passed ISO 27001 certification.
